reviewText: i loved this movie. i can watch it over and over!!! if you are a romantic, get this movie...now. you will love it!!!
This is a very enjoyable movie. The young heroine really believes that her kiss awakened the frog to a real live prince. The end is really a great surprise!
It enjoyed the movie.  My nieces i can not tell you if they enjoyed the movie or not.  It might still be in the original case I gave to them for Christmas.
This was a Christmas gift for my daughter. Saw this movie on Hallmark and just loved it! Would highly recommend to anyone who loves an upbeat "girly" movie.

The girl and her fascination with the the tale of the frog who turns into a prince...makes her see everything it that light.

Even the chace encouter with the real prince in the boat where he washed up after his mugging.

Lots of humor. Lots of fun.

Buy it and enjoy - over and over again.

A fairytale, a romantic comedy, and a not perfect Hallmark film saved by the performances, especially, by the child actor.

A young girl(Kiernan Shipka, "Mad Men") saves a frog and imagines that the coincidental finding of an amnesiac "prince" or marquis(Simon Kassianidas) is in fact the frog incarnate.  The girl hauls him off in a grocery cart taking him home to hide in her closet- yes, one must suspend reality quickly in this movie- with the plan to matchmake with her lonely, overly organized, widowed mother(Kellie Martin, still alive after "ER").

There's a lot to swallow here.  The daughter convinces the mom to keep the man as a nanny- shades of "Family Affair".  He is handsome and very properly polite. So, no big deal.  Right. And the predictable romance ensues.  The problem pops up with his past, and that he is already engaged and of nobility.  Will love out?

Kiernan Shipka steals and carries the show; I found the chemistry somewhat lacking between the mom and the prince.  Perhaps, the way Kellie Martin plays the mom with such severity dampened it for me.  I don't know, maybe it's just me.

It's fun enough and does what's expected of it.  I'd give it 3 stars, but for Shipka's energy and the fact, my young daughters like it-> OK, OK 4 stars.  Family friendly with background theme of deceased father, a drunk experience with the prince, and frog kissing.

P.S.- Besides the recent Disney "Princess and the Frog", there was also a good musical, difficult to find, starring Aileen Quinn(Annie from "Annie"), Helen Hunt and John Paragon.

My wife and I saw this movie on the Hallmark channel and at first were not going to watch it, thinking it would be too childish.  We were pleasantly surprised as the story was cleverly adapted from "The Princess and the Frog" and the acting is great,  especially the young girl who is the real star.  Highly recommend!
THIS MOVIE IS MORE SUITED TO KIDS.

This is a really cute story that I had tried to watch on TV several times but always ended up missing parts of it--due to trying to watch it at work.

While a romance tale, it has a great family quality with it centering around a young girl's belief that the man she found in the park was the frog she'd kissed and turned loose just before getting distracted.

Watching the amnesiac royal find his true place/love while working as a nanny, or 'manny', and bringing happiness to a number of people, is entertaining and heartwarming.

The DVD arrived in quick order and played beautifully.

Very amateurish movie, sorry for my lack of good things to say about it, but I wasted 1,5 hours of my life here, jeez (and 5 bucks). I didn't have to watch all of it but I was kinda hoping something magical would happen and make it awesome.

This is a cute movie for kids and parents, or for a sap like me. I enjoy a family movie that makes me laugh. If you have not seen this movie on cable, and it has been shown many times, a prince who is tired of the life he is being forced into, rebels, drinks a little too much, is robbed, and dumped into a river. There, a young girl finds him after kissing a frog and freeing him from a potential lab experiment at her school. She finds the disheveled prince at the river where she let the frog loose, and believes she turned the frog into a real live prince. She then plays matchmaker for her mother and the prince. I'll stop here and not spoil it for anyone, but I'm sure you get the idea. It's simple, it's cute, and it will make kids, parents, and couples smile. I have watched it many times, and will do so again.
Poor movie, improbable story, less than optimal acting.  I would not purchase this again or recommend it to anyone else.

This is a cute one! It's similar to a fairy tale if you liked those. The young girl helps out a royal 'frog' person who in turn helps her. It does have a nice ending! A real family story for everyone. One of my favorites Kellie Martin is the mother & Simojn Kassianides is the  handsome royal. The 11 yr old girl does an outstanding role in this.
Talk about a Prince Charming movie! Simon was an adorable "prince" to watch and the daughter was priceless. This is a movie to watch over and over again.

Cute romance, a good Mommy and Me movie time.  Hallmark did a good job of keeping it light and flowing, while incorporating a child's imagination.  It's a movie about a young girl that still belives in Knights and Prince Charming.
Thinking that the storys are real, she finds what she thinks is a real Prince that had been turned into a frog.  Thinking that her kiss had broken the spell, she takes him home.  Havoc insues, as this Prince gaines employment as the little girls nanny (with the girls help) and untimaly falls in love with the little girls mother.

As with any Hallmark romance, you know he gets the girl, but the road there is a fun one ot watch.  Safe for adults and children alike.  No worries if your 5 year old comes into the room.
If you haven't seen it, it's very good. Funny, sentimental. The little girl in it is the reason to watch it.
I saw this movie on the Hallmark Channel and really enjoyed it.  It is a sappy romance movie but the storyline revolved a lot around the young child in this movie.

Loved it!

great for not just dog lovers, so girly movie it's so funny, amazing, family style wonderful movie. Boy meets girl in a much different way than you would think. Opposites due attract and love is in the air. great movie for all to see. Highly recommend.

Don't question this movie too closely, just enjoy the delights it has to offer (which are many).  It's fun and romantic.  I'll definitely be watching it again and again.  There's just enough suspense to spice up the sweetness.  Kiernan Shipka is a wonderful young actress.

Based on the classic fairytale The Frog Prince, this charming romantic comedy asks whether, in todays crazy world, a man and a woman can ever live happily ever after ... Rakishly handsome English Royal Percy has just arrived in America for his long awaited arranged marriage. But, while strolling through San Francisco s Golden Gate Park later that night, he is mugged and wakes the next morning with amnesia. On that same morning, Zoe, a precocious 11-year-old, can t bring herself to dissect a frog in science class, so packs him safely into her lunchbox and sets off for the park instead.

Cue a serendipitous misunderstanding, as Zoe kisses the frog farewell at the water s edge and the Prince awakens nearby Zoe thinks she has turned the frog into a man! With no recollection as to who or where he is, Percy or Flynn as Zoe calls her Prince has no option but to be led back to Zoe s home. She soon realizes that the only way she can keep her Prince is to have Flynn impersonate a potential nanny and convince her beautiful widowed mother, Gwen, to hire him.

With the clock ticking and his Royal family searching for him, Flynn whose memory gradually returns finds himself falling for Gwen. When he is found by his family and his intended future wife, the truth comes out, leaving them all with decisions to make. Can Flynn, Gwen and Zoe make their Valentine's Day dreams come true?
What an imagination!  Fun movie about a real prince who is spoiled, but finds his worth from a little girl and her mother when he becomes the nanny.
This movie is so cute.  It is predictable, but fun to watch.  It is family friendly and I would recommend it to a friend.

When you watch a made-for-TV Hallmark movie, sometimes you have to push believability aside. It's just a movie and you can only make the same movie so many times. This movie is rather original, unfortunately, that makes it hard to believe. I guess you can't have it both ways. I actually found the male lead attractive, although on the cover he doesn't look so great. I have always liked Kelli Martin from Christy and Life Goes On, so I thought I'd try this movie out. I would recommend watching it at least once. I may actually watch it once a year around Valentine's Day, as it is centered around that holiday.
This is a really a cute movie for all family. a lot like another prince & frog movie.  The acting is very good for a young girl too.

Smooch is fun and funny and pulls all kinds of heart stings.  Issues of preteen infatuation, peer pressure and still believing in make-believe are only some of Zoe's daily trials. She takes her frog to the park in San Francisco instead of dissecting him and sets him free and finds a real Prince and takes him home in a shopping cart. She calls him Flynn after her favorite character in a book, hides him from her widowed Mom and turns him into a nanny candidate, as the poor prince has forgot his identity.

Valentine's Day arrives with Flynn's memory but he hesitates only to be found out. Gwen, Zoe's mom has fallen for him and he leaves to resume his real life.  Will Prince charming return or does it turn into a tragedy?  You will just have to watch the movie to see the ending...
We watched this on a dreary day.  It's fun and light hearted.  We both enjoyed it.  I'll be watching this again.

It's a fairy tale type film so it's not realistic of course, but a really cute clean fun family film. I thought the film was adorable; However, it might be good to discuss with your children that it's not smart to take a drunk rich stranger home without telling your parents first. LOL.

"Smooch" is a wonderful feel-good family movie. With a standard Hollywood cast, it could have been an ordinary TV movie-of-the-week, but the casting is so brilliant here that it is raised well above that level.

Simon Kassianides, as the amnesiac British royal, whom young Zoe thinks she has transformed from a frog to a prince,  is superb in his role. Kellie Martin, as Zoe's mother, gives her usual stellar performance. All the supporting players are equally brilliant.

The crucial role, however, is that of Zoe, the young girl, obsessed with a rather hackneyed and unconvincing version of the old fairy tale of "The Frog Prince". Successfully selling the unlikely plot of this movie to a cynical 21st Century audience hinges on the performance of its child star. It requires a unique combination of beauty, vulnerability, charm and acting talent. If any of these factors had been less than perfect, the movie might have failed miserably. Fortunately, Kiernan Shipka has all these qualities and more. Her performance is flawless, and she draws the viewer in, turning an otherwise silly story into a wonderfully moving experience.

this is one of my christmas list items and it was a very good item at a good price, thank you. this is the tv show from when i was a kid and they are not so bad as are the ones on today tv. i would rather pay to buy good things for kids to watch than to allow them to see the evil and bad tv shows of today.

A girl who did not have the heart to dissect a frog in her chemistry class sneaks it from the classroom.  On her way home she releases it into a lake, but it lands on a man who was asleep in a canoe.  She thinks the frog turned into the man and takes him home with her.  Then the fun begins.

This film is a very sweet and charming affair and very suitable for young viewers. The plot is "Frog Prince-ish" and is simple to follow. A great movie that you can comfortably sit down with youngsters to watch without being worried that something unsuitable might crop up! Yes, it can seem all very unlikely, but what the heck!!

I really enjoyed this movie.  I have like Kelly Martin ever since she starred in the TV show "Life Goes On".  The story of this movie was really cute, and if you don't have the Hallmark Channel or just missed it when it was on, take the opportunity to buy one for your home.

What girl doesn't want to meet a Prince?  However when he has amnesia and doesn't remember he is a prince and becomes your nanny.  Not sure if I would truly consider this a Rom/Com, but what else could you classify it.

I watched this on Hallmark, recorded it and didn't expect too much, but loved every funny second, and even re-watched the thing twice before I could let myself delete it from the DVR.  Yeah, I'll be buying it too.  Simple, sweet, (well written, well cast, well performed) pleasure.  It belongs on your video list or shelf to pull out every once in a while because you just want to see it again.

Brief synopsis: the fairy tale of a frog turning into a prince comes to life! - or does he!
A gift for my mom to view and she enjoyed it very much. It was worth the money and it was good.

I like good clean movies (or as clean as you can get nowadays). Smooch was really quite clean. I really enjoyed the movie and will definitely watch it again.  I originally saw this movie on Hallmark Channel and bought it as soon as it came to DVD.  Most people would skip it because they think it is too predictable or "lame", but I like movies like that because I know I will be watching something that won't make me feel like I have just been "slimed".

Percy is a handsome (once he shaves) royal prince who is having an arranged marriage and is therefore engaged to a woman he doesn't love. After being beat up in the park by two men, he gets amnesia.  Zoe, a young girl who loves romantic fairytales, comes across Percy and believes that she has turned a frog that she kissed into the prince (who has webbed toes) from the fairy tales in her books and promptly brings him home.  Before her dad died he told her that he wanted her and her mom to someday have another someone special, so she helps Flynn (the frog-prince) by giving him a total makeover and trains him to become her male nanny (a difficult position when your employer is obsessed with detail, lists and organization) and hopefully allow the prince to rescue her mother.  However, Zoe's Mom, Gwen, being a single Mom and owner of the family restaurant is too busy to think about anything other than providing for her and her daughter and also can't let go of the memory of her husband to allow herself to be happy again and have fun.  Despite Gwen not believing in "magic" Flynn disarms Gwen.  He is charming she sees the relationship that he has with her daughter, the love that he has for her and that makes Gwen feel so comfortable with letting him into their lives.  And then once he is in their lives she can't help but fall in love with him.  Zoe really wants a father figure, which Flynn/Percy becomes, and they become a wonderful family, even after they (including Flynn) find out who he really is.

I love how even though this family isn't a perfect family, it all comes together.  It is a feel good movie/drama/love story that is told in a very family friendly way.  Overall, I loved the movie and will watch it again.

A fine choice of characters, with a fairy tale story that must be taken as a "For Fun Flick". The developing love angle was nice, tender. I noted that there were no "Nasty or suggestive" language or even double meaning dialog. I appreciate a movie that "Keeps it clean". This is a good one to share with the whole family.
Very enjoyable viewing.  Anyone at any age could watch it and find it entertaining.  Glad I purchased this sweet film.

This is a nice Hallmark movie based on the story of the Frog Prince.  Fantasy movie; but everyone needs an escape from today's world events.and this movie surely is a nice movie that serves that purpose.
Cute little movie (Hallmark) with a nice message. Very clean, good for family. Pre-teen and teen girls would like it the best, but we all enjoyed it.

A variation of a fairy tale in which the Prince becomes a frog.  Combine that with a twist of Pygmalion (My Fair lady which in this case is more like My Fair Man) and you have a delightful tale of romance.
This movie is enjoyable, delightful, and entertaining. We have viewed it several times....once from the library and just had to purchase it. This is a good, clean family movie.

More or less, it starts like this: One evening, in San Francisco, when Percival (Simon Kassianides), the spoiled Marques of Summerland, flashes his wad of cash in a bar and then wanders off to Golden Gate Park in a drunken stupor, he's just asking to get rolled. And he gets rolled. He absorbs a, um, royal beating.

The next morning 11-year-old Zoe Cole (Kiernan Shipka) ditches school. She arrives at the very same park to set free the frog she'd rescued from a science class dissection. It's like this: Zoe frequently inhabits an inner world in which she indulges her fascination with the fairy tale of The Frog Prince. By the pond in the park, she gives the frog a farewell good luck kiss. Moments later she glimpses an addled man folded into a boat. She eyeballs the royal sash on him and the webbed toes and comes to the only conclusion that a girl with big imagination could.

I don't know that SMOOCH is the best film ever produced by Hallmark. But, hopefully, my even bringing it up gives an idea of just how much I enjoyed it. It's wonderfully whimsical. Young Kiernan Shipka is delightful. In raising her acting creds, I'll try not to bring up that she's a two-time SAG Award-winning actor (oops!). She anchors the film as Zoe whom she plays as lively and wistful and fanciful. Zoe has a great hope. She's targeting the upcoming Valentine's Day as when her widowed mom, Gwen (Kellie Martin), meets her mystery knight. But Zoe isn't contemplating that one bit when she manipulates her mom into hiring as her new nanny him what she mistakes for her Frog Prince. Zoe dubs him "Flynn Stewart," after the frog hero of her favorite book. Percy, the English Royal now stricken with amnesia, plays along. I got a grin out of reading one of the papers Zoe works up to validate his nanny position. It read: "Flynn Stewart, Nanny and Man Servant to Royal and Diginifed Society" (yes, "Diginifed").

Simon Kassianides is terrific. I imagine the ladies will eat up the way he delivers his lines. There's nothing like an Englishman to roll off the eloquent dialogue. There's a sense of satisfaction derived from watching his character's growth from vain nobleman to charming, caring nanny. Kassianides makes it an effortless transition. Kellie Martin is solid in a less showy role, playing Zoe's guarded mom who shies from opening her heart. She and Kassianides strike up some sparks, but, honestly, it's the chemistry between Kassianides and Kiernan Shipka that lights up the screen. The plot contrives this and that obstacle, as it must, but neither Percy's impending arranged marriage nor his debilitating vertigo nor a mother's seeming inflexibility can work up enough traction to derail this fractured Frog Prince fairy tale. I loved SMOOCH. I plan to watch it many times with my nieces. Watching it, you know that there's a happily ever after in store. But it's the getting there that's so much fun. Again, Kiernan Shipka makes an impression. I may start watching MAD MEN.

This movie is a great romantic comedy.  It is good clean fun and movie that the entire family can watch and not have to worry about gratuitous sex or violence.  Too much of that in both large screen and small screen today.  It is nice when films like this are made!  My husband and I would recommend this film to anyone!
